reference_master.name: 2025 Steven Wilson Remix
reference_master.characteristics: Modern remix with emphasis on clarity and dynamics

loudness.note: Conservative peak levels, well below clipping

dynamics.note: Very high DR - strong dynamic preservation in original

frequency.note: Dark tone (low spectral centroid), massive bass boost vs mid

stereo.note: Moderate stereo width - typical of live rock recording

loudness.note: Slightly lower RMS, peaks optimized to ceiling (-0.24 dB)

dynamics.note: Reduced DR (-23 dB) but still excellent dynamic preservation

frequency.note: Slightly darker tone, slightly more bass-heavy, warmer presence

stereo.note: Slightly narrower stereo (more focused), tighter L/R correlation

loudness_changes.interpretation: Wilson slightly reduced RMS (more dynamic), optimized peaks to ceiling

dynamics_changes.interpretation: DR reduction expected for professional remaster, but CF increase is GOOD

frequency_changes.interpretation: Wilson INCREASED bass-to-mid ratio (1.15 dB MORE bass boost) and brightened treble presence (2.3 dB more)

stereo_changes.interpretation: Slightly tightened stereo image for focus, but still maintains live character

key_insights.bass_processing: IMPORTANT: Steven Wilson INCREASED bass relative to midrange by +1.15 dB, contradicting our assumption that bass should be minimal
key_insights.treble_enhancement: Wilson brightened treble region by +2.3 dB relative to mid (improving clarity presence)
key_insights.dynamic_handling: Crest factor increased (GOOD - transient preservation), but overall DR reduced (expected for mastering)
key_insights.loudness_approach: Wilson kept RMS conservative but optimized peaks - suggests focus on headroom and transient handling
key_insights.stereo_treatment: Subtle - only -0.041 width change, maintaining live recording character
key_insights.genre_characteristics: Classic rock live recording - Wilson preserved dynamic character while modernizing frequency response

frequency_response: Bass boost of +1-1.5 dB vs midrange is CORRECT for rock (not excessive)
Our current +3.2 dB bass on rock tracks is OVER-BOOSTED vs Wilson standard
Should be targeting: +1.0-1.5 dB bass boost, not +3.2 dB
Treble presence should be enhanced by +2-3 dB relative to mid (currently neutral)
dynamic_handling: Crest factor of 6.53 is GOOD target (we have 3.8, need improvement)
Keep dynamic range high - Wilson shows 96 dB is acceptable for pro master
Focus on transient preservation (CF increase) not overall DR reduction
stereo_treatment: Live recordings benefit from maintained stereo width (Wilson only reduced by 0.041)
Don't over-narrow stereo field - maintain live character
